content:
Hello everyone,

I came here since I'm new to contributing to Rust, but I have been loving the language and I would really like to help out

Currently, I'm working on this issue, specifically I am looking into renaming not_undef to check_init.

It looks like this function is defined and used exclusively in src/librustc_mir/interpret/value.rs, from what I have read I mostly just need to fork the rust repo, make the changes, then create a pull request?
mostly, I think https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/getting-started.html#configuring-the-compiler is helpful to reduce the time spend compiling rustc itself
so I guess the plan here is to change the method name, and then either use search and replace or just ./x.py check to get the remaining calls and rename them too
When working on search and replace problems, ripgrep is a godsend
oh ok, I'll look into that, I'm used to using the normal grep in the terminal or find in vscode.
iirc find in vscode uses ripgrep internally :thinking:
